ygData.subject: Re: Oasis Warning
ygData.msgSnippet: I fully agree with you.  There has got to be a way to control the servers but without the caps.  And if they do cap it, I think people should have the option
ygData.messageBody:
I fully agree with you. There has got to be a way to control the
servers but without the caps. And if they do cap it, I think people
should have the option to be allowed to permanently move their
character to a less populated server. But, it should be OPTIONAL to
move. A forced move is just not fair.

I agree with your statements about the realm. I am an ex realmie. I
remember before EQ even went into beta. The Realm put a server cap on
it. I would wait for over an hour just trying to get in, or wait in
line trying to get in. Then, I would have to wait even longer for my
friends to be able to log in. It was horrible and I was extremely
upset about it. The realm lacked updates, and just before I left, it
lacked a staff period! We were on our own. Hackers got control and
the servers would be down for days. I dont think this is gonna happen
in EQ though, they seem to be competent. It's a well publicized game
also, unlike The Realm. The realm was only available by mail order
through sierra's catalog.

In any case, a cap would have it's advantages, it would also have alot
of drawbacks.

Adira
High Elf Bandaid

--- Azor <jmaynus@...> wrote:
> From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
>
> A cap might be nice but put it to low and you'll
> have a lot off ticked off
> people cause they can't get onto their server. If
> that starts to happen we
> might see a lot of ppl quiting the game, ya I know
> less ppl playing means
> more places to hunt without fighting over who gets
> what kill and less lag.
> But thing about that less ppl playing (less money
> for Verant) less money for
> them could mean the end of EverQuest, I mean look at
> other games such as the
> Realm. The Realm at first was a big game, but over
> time ppl got tired of it
> and they quit playing where is the Realm now? It
> might still be there but
> how often is it updated, how many ppl are on there
> now to play with or
> against? I like EQ about as much as the next
> person, but I have a feeling
> we won't see it around or as big as it is now for
> I'd say 2-3 more years,
> with games such as Middle-Earth, Asherions Call and
> I've heard of one more
> coming out. If these 3 games hit it big a lot of
> ppl with switch from EQ to
> them, if they switch these 3 games to put an end to
> EQ.
>
> **************************
> Azor
> Lvl 18 Human Cleric of The Rathe
> **************************
>
>
